segments.text: I can’t believe how much water is on the floor now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying that same plate over and over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s lost in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is about to fall, and I don’t think anyone will catch him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is so close to him, but she’s not even trying to steady the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they’ve done this before and gotten away with it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and the boy is still reaching for more.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m surprised the woman hasn’t heard the stool creaking under his weight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is getting closer to the kids, and I’m worried they’ll slip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off that faucet soon.
segments.speaker: PAR
